dcterms:creator: E. Grosicki
M. Carré
E. Geoﬀrois
E. Augustin
F. Preteux
dcterms:description: The RIMES dataset is a benchmark for handwritten text recognition, consisting of isolated words drawn from various handwritten manuscripts, including postal mails and faxes. It contains 51,738 images for training, 7,464 for validation, and 7,776 for testing, with a total of 12,723 pages written by 1,300 volunteers.
dcterms:title: RIMES

dcterms:creator: T. Van der Zant
L. Schomaker
K. Haak
J. P. Van Oosten
dcterms:description: The KdK dataset, also known as Het Kabinet der Koningin, contains historical handwritten documents from the Dutch Queens Office, featuring 172,440 word images. It includes words written between 1798 and 1988, with a focus on the year 1903, and is used for evaluating handwritten word recognition systems.
dcterms:title: KdK (Het Kabinet der Koningin)
